GYS Class Reference

#include <gys.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

GYS interpreter class.

Main class in the libary, represents interpreter objects.


Public Member Functions

Member Function Documentation

bool GYS::add_binary_op (  string  opname,
string  l_type,
string  r_type,
GYS_BINARY_OP_FUNC_PTR  pf
) 
 

Adds new binary operator (operand1@operand2).

Only these binary operators can be defined by user:

  • + -
  • * /
  • := = += -= *= /= =
  • == != === !== < > <= >= && ||
  • << >> <<= >>=
  • []

Note:
Binary operator is specified only by its name and type of its left operand, so user can't define 2 different operators like type1@type2 and type1@type3. Use "[" or "[]" opname for operator [].
Parameters:
opname operator's name (e.g. "+" or "[]").
l_type type of the left operand.
r_type type of the right operand.
pf user function which processes this operator.
Returns:
true if function succeeded, false otherwise.
See also:
remove_binary_op()

bool GYS::add_global_var (  string  var_name,
GYS_ret_val  val
) 
 

Adds new global variable (constant).

All the global variables are stored in the static member table of this class thus they will exist until program ends.

Note:
Use "@var_name" syntax to define new constant "var_name". In this case this variable's value can't be changed by interpreter during evaluations, but can be changed "manually" using this function.
Parameters:
var_name variable's name.
val value assigned to this variable.
Returns:
true if function succeeded, false otherwise.
See also:
add_local_var(), remove_global_var()

bool GYS::add_gys_converter (  string  from_type,
string  into_type,
GYS_CONVERTER_PTR  pf
) 
 

Adds new conversion.

Parameters:
from_type source type.
into_type desired type.
pf converter (user function which performs the conversion).
Returns:
true if function succeeded, false otherwise.
See also:
remove_gys_converter(), exec_converter()

GYS_FUNC_PTR  pf
)

GYS_TYPE_FUNC_PTR  pf
)

bool GYS::add_local_var (  string  var_name,
GYS_ret_val  val
) 
 

Adds new local variable (constant).

Note:
Use "@var_name" syntax to define new constant "var_name". In this case this variable's value can't be changed by interpreter during evaluations, but can be changed "manually" using this function.
Parameters:

Returns:

See also:

bool GYS::add_post_unary_op (  string  opname,
string  l_type,
GYS_POST_UNARY_OP_FUNC_PTR  pf
) 
 

Adds new postfix unary operator (operand@).

Only these postfix unary operators can be defined by user:

  • (
  • ++ --
  • . ->

Parameters:
opname operator's name (e.g. "++" or "(").
l_type type of the left (and the only) operand.
pf user function which processes this operator.
Returns:
true if function succeeded, false otherwise.
See also:
remove_post_unary_op()

bool GYS::add_pre_unary_op (  string  opname,
string  ret_type,
GYS_PRE_UNARY_OP_FUNC_PTR  pf
) 
 

Adds new prefix unary operator (@operand).

Only these prefix unary operators can be defined by user:

  • !
  • + -
  • ++ --

Note:
Unary operator is specified only by its name and type of its result value. Interpreter evaluates right operand as the value of operator's return type.
Parameters:
opname operator's name (e.g. "-" or "!").
ret_type type of the return value.
pf user function which processes this operator.
Returns:
true if function succeeded, false otherwise.
See also:
remove_pre_unary_op()

void GYS::copy_params_to_sub (  GYS *  script  ) 
 

Copies current language definition into other script and becomes its superscript.

script pointer to the target script.

script pointer to the target script.

string  str2 = ""
)

str1 message string.
str2 another message string (e.g. contains some detailed information).
See also:

void GYS::finish_script (   ) 
 

Finishes interpretation.

After calling this function is_finished()==true, token type=GYS_EOF and interpreter checks the return value (can generate error).

See also:
interp_next(), interp()

long GYS::get_error_num (   )  const
 

Gets total error+fatal_error count.

Returns:
Number of errors and fatal errors.
See also:
get_warning_num(), error(), fatal_error()

GYS_ret_val GYS::get_var_val (  string  var_name  )

true - if interpretation is finished, false - otherwise.
See also:
finish_script()

void GYS::putback_tok (   ) 
 

Puts current token back (once).

This function just forces lexer to skip next get_token() call. It doesn't restore previous token's params.

void GYS::set_input (  istream *  in  ) 
 

Sets input.

Attention:
This function totally reinitializes interpreter (clears language definition, variables, handlers etc.).
